_description: Rapoport-Luebering shunt parameters for 2,3-BPG regulation in human red blood cells

_citations.discovery: Rose ZB, Liebowitz J. 2,3-diphosphoglycerate phosphatase from human erythrocytes. General properties and activation by anions. J Biol Chem. 1970;245(12):3232-3241
_citations.bpg_function: Benesch R, Benesch RE. The effect of organic phosphates from the human erythrocyte on the allosteric properties of hemoglobin. Biochem Biophys Res Commun. 1967;26(2):162-167
_citations.bpg_nature: Benesch R, Benesch RE. Intracellular organic phosphates as regulators of oxygen release by haemoglobin. Nature. 1969;221(5181):618-622
_citations.model: Mulquiney PJ, Kuchel PW. Model of 2,3-bisphosphoglycerate metabolism in the human erythrocyte based on detailed enzyme kinetic equations. Biochem J. 1999;342(Pt 3):567-580
_citations.oxygen_affinity: Bunn HF, Forget BG. Hemoglobin: Molecular, Genetic and Clinical Aspects. Philadelphia: WB Saunders; 1986

bisphosphoglycerate_mutase._notes: Diverts 1,3-BPG from ATP-generating PGK reaction; product-inhibited by 2,3-BPG

bisphosphoglycerate_phosphatase._notes: Slow enzyme; determines steady-state 2,3-BPG level; inhibited by Pi and 3-PG

normal_13bpg_mM._notes: Very low due to rapid metabolism

shunt_ratio._notes: Approximately 20% of 1,3-BPG flows through shunt at steady state

oxygen_affinity._description: Relationship between 2,3-BPG and hemoglobin oxygen affinity
oxygen_affinity._notes: P50 = base_p50 + dpg_effect * [2,3-BPG]. Normal [2,3-BPG] ~5 mM gives P50 ~27 mmHg

ph_regulation._notes: Acidosis decreases 2,3-BPG (inhibits BPGM), alkalosis increases it
